mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Has been ill for the last three months; focusing his attention on the establishment of what he hopes will be the University of Virginia; plans to have ten professors there, the "ablest which America or Europe can furnish"; they will live in an academic village together, one per house; the buildings "shall be models of chaste architecture."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1818 November 10, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [William] Short, n.p.
